 10  *
 11  * @license Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
 12  * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
 13  * You may obtain a copy of the License at
 14  *
 15  *    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
 16  *
 17  * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
 18  * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
 19  * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
 20  * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 21  * limitations under the License.
 22  *

 26 
 27 require.def('antie/widgets/list',
 28 	[
 29 		'antie/widgets/container',
 30 		'antie/widgets/listitem',
 31 		'antie/iterator',
 32 		'antie/events/databoundevent',
 33 		'antie/events/selecteditemchangeevent'
 34 	],
 35 	function(Container, ListItem, Iterator, DataBoundEvent, SelectedItemChangeEvent) {
 36 		/**
 37 		 * The List widget contains an ordered list of items which may be populated either by a static
 38 		 * array or by binding to an asynchronous data source.
 39 		 * Note: The List widget has no spatial navigation. See {@link antie.widgets.VerticalList}
 40 		 * and {@link antie.widgets.HorizontalList} for widgets that support spatial navigation.
 41 		 * @name antie.widgets.List
 42 		 * @class
 43 		 * @extends antie.widgets.Container
 44 		 * @requires antie.widgets.ListItem
 45 		 * @requires antie.Iterator
 46 		 * @requires antie.events.DataBoundEvent
 47 		 * @requires antie.events.SelectedItemChangeEvent
 48 		 * @param {String} [id] The unique ID of the widget. If excluded, a temporary internal ID will be used (but not included in any output).
 49 		 * @param {antie.Formatter} [itemFormatter] A formatter class used on each data item to generate the list item child widgets.
 50 		 * @param {antie.DataSource|Array} [dataSource] An array of data to be used to generate the list items, or an asynchronous data source.
 51 		 */
 52 		var List = Container.extend(/** @lends antie.widgets.List.prototype */ {
 53 			/**
 54 			 * @constructor
 55 			 * @ignore
 56 			 */
 57 			init: function(id, itemFormatter, dataSource) {
 58 				this._selectedIndex = 0;
 59 				this._dataSource = dataSource;
 60 				this._itemFormatter = itemFormatter;
 61 				this._dataBound = false;
 62 				this._totalDataItems = 0;
 63 				this._renderMode = List.RENDER_MODE_CONTAINER;
 64 				this._dataBindingOrder = List.DATA_BIND_FORWARD;
 65 
 66 				this._super(id);
 67 				this.addClass('list');
 68 			},
 69 			/**
 70 			 * Appends a child widget to this widget, creating a new list item.
 71 			 * @param {antie.widgets.Widget} widget The child widget to add.
 72 			 */
 73 			appendChildWidget: function(widget) {
 74 				if ((this._renderMode == List.RENDER_MODE_LIST) && !(widget instanceof ListItem)) {
 75 					var li = new ListItem();
 76 					li.appendChildWidget(widget);
 77 					li.setDataItem(widget.getDataItem());
 78 					this._super(li);
 79 					return li;
 80 				} else {
 81 					widget.addClass('listitem');
 82 					this._super(widget);
 83 					return widget;
 84 				}
 85 			},
 86 			/**
 87 			 * Inserts a child widget at the specified index.
 88 			 * @param {Integer} index The index where to insert the child widget.
 89 			 * @param {antie.widgets.Widget} widget The child widget to add.
 90 			 */
 91 			insertChildWidget: function(index, widget) {
 92 				var w;
 93 				if ((this._renderMode == List.RENDER_MODE_LIST) && !(widget instanceof ListItem)) {
 94 					w = new ListItem();
 95 					w.appendChildWidget(widget);
 96 					w.setDataItem(widget.getDataItem());
 97 					this._super(index, w);
 98 				} else {
 99 				    widget.addClass('listitem');
100 					this._super(index, widget);
101 					w = widget;
102 				}
103 				if (index <= this._selectedIndex && 
104 						(( this._selectedIndex + 1 ) < this.getChildWidgetCount()) ) {
105 					this._selectedIndex++;
106 				}
107 				return widget;
108 			},
109 			/**
110 			 * Attempt to set focus to the given child widget.
111 			 * Note: You can only set focus to a focusable widget. A focusable widget is one that
112 			 * contains an enabled antie.widgets.Button as either a direct or indirect child.
113 			 * @param {antie.widgets.Widget} widget The child widget to set focus to.
114 			 * @returns Boolean true if the child widget was focusable, otherwise boolean false.
115 			 */
116 			setActiveChildWidget: function(widget) {
117 				var changed = this._activeChildWidget != widget;
118 				if (this._super(widget)) {
119 					this._selectedIndex = this.getIndexOfChildWidget(widget);
120 					if (changed) {
121 						this.bubbleEvent(new SelectedItemChangeEvent(this, widget, this._selectedIndex));
122 					}
123 					return true;
124 				} else {
125 					return false;
126 				}
127 			},
128 			/**
129 			 * Renders the widget and any child widgets to device-specific output. If the list is bound
130 			 * to an asynchronous data source, get the data.
131 			 * @param {antie.devices.Device} device The device to render to.
132 			 * @returns A device-specific object that represents the widget as displayed on the device (in a browser, a DOMElement);
133 			 */
134 			render: function(device) {
135 				if (!this._dataBound && this._dataSource && this._itemFormatter) {
136 					this._createDataBoundItems(device);
137 				}
138 				if (!this.outputElement && (this._renderMode == List.RENDER_MODE_LIST)) {
139 					this.outputElement = device.createList(this.id, this.getClasses());
140 				}
141 				return this._super(device);
142 			},
143 			/**
144 			 * Create list items from the bound data.
145 			 * @private
146 			 * @param {antie.devices.Device} device The device to render to.
147 			 */
148 			_createDataBoundItems: function(device) {
149 				this._dataBound = true;
150 
151 				var self = this;
152 
153 				function processDataCallback (data) {
154 					self.removeChildWidgets();
155 
156 					var iterator = (data instanceof Iterator) ? data : new Iterator(data);
157 					while (iterator.hasNext()) {
158 						var i = iterator._currentIndex;
159 
160 						var w = self._itemFormatter.format(iterator);
161 						w._listIndex = i;
162 						if(self._dataBindingOrder === List.DATA_BIND_FORWARD) {
163 							self.appendChildWidget(w)
164 						} else if(self._dataBindingOrder === List.DATA_BIND_REVERSE){
165 							self.insertChildWidget(0, w);
166 						}
167 					}
168 					self._totalDataItems = iterator._currentIndex;
169 
170 					self.bubbleEvent(new DataBoundEvent("databound", self, iterator));
171 				}
172 
173 				function processDataError (response) {
174 					self.removeChildWidgets();
175 					self.bubbleEvent(new DataBoundEvent("databindingerror", self, null, response));
176 				}
177 
178 				self.bubbleEvent(new DataBoundEvent("beforedatabind", self));
179 				if (!this._dataSource || (this._dataSource instanceof Array)) {
180 					processDataCallback(this._dataSource);
181 				} else {
182 					this._dataSource.load({
183 						onSuccess: processDataCallback,
184 						onError: processDataError
185 					});
186 				}
187 			},
188 			/**
189 			 * Binds the list to a different data source. If the list is already rendered,
190 			 * the output will be updated to reflect the new data.
191 			 * @param {antie.DataSource} dataSource The data source to bind to.
192 			 */
193 			setDataSource: function(dataSource) {
194 				// abort currently processing data requests
195 				if (this._dataSource && typeof(this._dataSource.abort) === "function") {
196 					this._dataSource.abort();
197 				}
198 				this._dataSource = dataSource;
199 				if (this.outputElement) {
200 					this._createDataBoundItems(this.getCurrentApplication().getDevice());
201 				}
202 			},
203 			/**
204 			 * Invalidates the data-related bindings - causing items to be re-created on next render;
205 			 */
206 			resetDataBindings: function() {
207 				this._dataBound = false;
208 			},
209 			/**
210 			 * Re-iterates the data source, recreating list items.
211 			 */
212 			rebindDataSource: function() {
213 				this._dataBound = false;
214 				this.setDataSource(this._dataSource);
215 			},
216 			/**
217 			 * Sets the rendering mode to either <code>List.RENDER_MODE_CONTAINER</code> or <code>List.RENDER_MODE_LIST</code>.
218 			 * List.RENDER_MODE_CONTAINER causes the list to be rendered as a generic container (e.g. <div>), with a generic container for each
219 			 * list item. List.RENDER_MODE_LIST causes the list to be rendered as a list (e.g. <ul>), with list item elements (e.g. <li>) for each item.
220 			 * @param {Integer} mode The rendering mode to use.
221 			 */
222 			setRenderMode: function(mode) {
223 				this._renderMode = mode;
224 			},
225 			/**
226 			 * Binds a progress indicator widget to this list.
227 			 * @param {antie.Widgets.HorizontalProgress} widget The progress indicator widget.
228 			 * @param {Function} [formatterCallback] A function that tkes the current item index and the total number of items and returns
229 			 *					a string to popular the progress indicator's label.
230 			 */
231 			bindProgressIndicator: function(widget, formatterCallback) {
232 				var self = this;
233 
234 				this._updateProgressHandler = function(evt) {
235 					if (evt.target !== self) {
236 						return;
237 					}
238 
239 					if (evt.type == 'beforedatabind') {
240 						widget.setText("");
241 						return;
242 					}
243 
244 					// TODO: This is a bit of a hack - if more data items were iterated over to populate the list
245 					// TODO: than there are items in the list, we assume some list items contain more than one
246 					// TODO: data item, therefore we have to use their position within the data source, rather than
247 					// TODO: their position within the rendered list widget.
248 
249 
250 					var ignore = self._childWidgetOrder.length - self._totalDataItems;
251 
252 					if (ignore < 0) {
253 						ignore = 0;
254 					}
255 
256 					var activeWidget = self.getActiveChildWidget();
257 					var index = (self._dataBound && activeWidget && (activeWidget._listIndex !== undefined))
258 						? activeWidget._listIndex
259 						: self._selectedIndex - ignore;
260 
261 					var total = self._childWidgetOrder.length - ignore;
262 
263 					var p;
264 					if (index < 0) {
265 						p = 0;
266 					} else {
267 						p = index / (total - 1);
268 						if (p < 0) {
269 							p = 0;
270 						}
271 					}
272 
273 					if (formatterCallback) {
274 						var val = formatterCallback(index + 1, total);
275 						if (typeof(val) == 'string') {
276 							widget.setText(val);
277 						} else {
278 							widget.setText(val.text);
279 							p = val.pos;
280 						}
281 					}
282 
283 					//if the formatter function has moved the position indicator, we don't change it
284 					widget.setValue(p);
285 				};
286 				this.addEventListener('selecteditemchange', this._updateProgressHandler);
287 				this.addEventListener('focus', this._updateProgressHandler);
288 				this.addEventListener('blur', this._updateProgressHandler);
289 				this.addEventListener('beforedatabind', this._updateProgressHandler);
290 				this.addEventListener('databound', this._updateProgressHandler);
291 			},
292 			/**
293 			 * Unbinds a previously-bound progress indicator widget.
294 			 */
295 			unbindProgressIndicator: function() {
296 				if (this._updateProgressHandler) {
297 					this.removeEventListener('selecteditemchange', this._updateProgressHandler);
298 					this.removeEventListener('focus', this._updateProgressHandler);
299 					this.removeEventListener('blur', this._updateProgressHandler);
300 					this.removeEventListener('databound', this._updateProgressHandler);
301 				}
302 			},
303 
304 			removeChildWidget: function(widget) {
305 				// TODO: Make this more generic - it will only work if carousel items contain a
306 				// TODO: single item of data.
307 				if (this._updateProgressHandler && (this._childWidgetOrder.length < this._totalDataItems)) {
308 					this.getCurrentApplication().getDevice().getLogger().warn("antie.widgets.List::removeChildWidget - removing"
309 						+ " list items where multiple data items are contained within each list item"
310 						+ " can cause unintended behaviour within any position indicator attached"
311 						+ " to the list.");
312 				}
313 
314 				var ignore = this._childWidgetOrder.length - this._totalDataItems;
315 				this._totalDataItems--;
316 				var retValue = this._super(widget);
317 				widget.removeClass('listitem');
318 
319 				for (var i = 0; i < this._childWidgetOrder.length; i++) {
320 					this._childWidgetOrder[i]._listIndex = i - ignore;
321 				}
322 				return retValue;
323 			},
324 			removeChildWidgets: function() {
325 				for (var i = 0; i < this._childWidgetOrder.length; i++) {
326 					this._childWidgetOrder[i].removeClass('listitem');
327 				}
328 
329 				this._totalDataItems = 0;
330 				return this._super();
331 			},
332 
333 			setDataBindingOrder: function(order) {
334 				this._dataBindingOrder = order;
335 			},
336 
337 			getDataBindingOrder: function() {
338 				return this._dataBindingOrder;
339 			}
340 		});
341 
342 		/**
343 		 * Render as a generic container (e.g. <div>), with a generic container for each list item.
344 		 * @name RENDER_MODE_CONTAINER
345 		 * @memberOf antie.widgets.List
346 		 * @constant
347 		 * @static
348 		 */
349 		List.RENDER_MODE_CONTAINER = 1;
350 		/**
351 		 * Render as a list (e.g. <ul>), with list item elements (e.g. <li>) for each item.
352 		 * @name RENDER_MODE_LIST
353 		 * @memberOf antie.widgets.List
354 		 * @constant
355 		 * @static
356 		 */
357 		List.RENDER_MODE_LIST = 2;
358 
359 		List.DATA_BIND_FORWARD = 0;
360 		List.DATA_BIND_REVERSE = 1;
361 
362 		return List;
363 	}
364 );
365
